page.title: 01Rufforth And District
page.content: {Rufforth,}a small village 5 miles to the West of{York,}is on the{B1224 York to{Wetherby}road.It is a typical{ {ribbon developed}village with houses clinging to the side of the road.However groups of new houses are being built on areas of land easily accessible to the main road. From the census figures of{1981}the population was{480}but due to the ever increasing development, the population in{1985}is probably{550. Rufforth is in the{Vale of York.}The surrounding area is mainly{arable}but with some{grassland}which is predominately used for{beef cattle.} Fields are mainly divided by{hedges} and{fences,}or the{dykes}which have been constructed to drain the water from the fields. The inhabitants may meet for village activities in the village Institute.
